content.description: Steep start up to a flake and small roof/bulge. Turn the bulge to the left (crux) and continue up angling slightly left and gradually easing in difficulty.  Shares anchor with Don't Tickle the Pickle. The somewhat spooky looking block past the third bolt is solid, although it has some grainy rock behind/around the flake.
content.protection: 9 bolts, lower off anchors.  Shares anchor with Don't Tickle the Pickle.
content.location: Second route to the right of the saguaro at the base. 15 feet right of Don't Tickle the Pickle.

content.description: Cruxy start and first few moves to easier climbing above.
content.location: The leftmost route at the crag. Starts just left of a cleft in the main wall.  About 15 feet up and left from Flesh Wound.

content.description: Nice route with good position and fairly continuous climbing. Crux low, but a bulge or two up high helps to keep things interesting.
content.location: First route left and uphill from the saguaro.

content.description: Follows moderate rock to steeper rock and a nice final bulge with good holds.  When pulling your rope on this route, stand uphill and left of the route to minimize chances of your rope dropping onto the prickly pear cactus near the base of the route.
content.location: Just right of a cleft in the wall. About 30 feet left and uphill from the big saguaro at the base.  This is the middle of 3 routes that are left of the saguaro.

content.description: Follows steep edges JUST right of the large saguaro at the base. You will pass very close to the arm of the saguaro. Stay right and Don't Tickle the Pickle.  Good steep edging and good rock that eases a bit as you get higher.
content.protection: 7 bolts, lower off anchors.  Shares anchor with route to the right (Thorny Issue).
content.location: Just right of the large saguaro.

content.description: This is a nice winter crag with a varied selection of moderate routes and a spectacular view of Tucson. All routes are bolted and have lower off anchors. Currently, there are 5 routes ranging from 5.8- to 5.10, with route lengths from 60 to 80 feet. The wall is in the shade in the morning and goes into the sun about noon in the winter. There is a nice flat hang at the base, with shade from a mesquite tree. Rock quality is mostly good. The approach takes about 20-25 minutes from the highway.  There is currently an unfinished route at the far right of the crag with 3 bolts and no hangers.
